title: segv in qtimer::interval()
body:
for the past couple of days, my owncloud client crashes upon startup (this is on ubuntu 13.10, but it already started when i was running 13.04).
looks like the timer that should be reset has not been initialized at all (eax is 0 at the point of crash).
the stack and disassembly in gdb looks like this:
```
(gdb) bt
#0  0xb6fc293e in qtimer::interval() const () from /usr/lib/libowncloudsync.so.0
#1  0xb6fbec92 in mirall::abstractnetworkjob::resettimeout() () from /usr/lib/libowncloudsync.so.0
#2  0xb6fc0d0c in mirall::checkserverjob::finished() () from /usr/lib/libowncloudsync.so.0
#3  0xb6fbf101 in mirall::abstractnetworkjob::slotfinished() () from /usr/lib/libowncloudsync.so.0
#4  0xb6fd9fd4 in ?? () from /usr/lib/libowncloudsync.so.0
#5  0xb719afc7 in qmetaobject::activate(qobject*, qmetaobject const*, int, void**) () from /usr/lib/i386-linux-gnu/libqtcore.so.4
#6  0xb73e5e95 in qnetworkreply::finished() () from /usr/lib/i386-linux-gnu/libqtnetwork.so.4
#7  0xb736a32f in ?? () from /usr/lib/i386-linux-gnu/libqtnetwork.so.4
#8  0xb734d2ee in ?? () from /usr/lib/i386-linux-gnu/libqtnetwork.so.4
#9  0xb7353c81 in ?? () from /usr/lib/i386-linux-gnu/libqtnetwork.so.4
#10 0xb73e56c4 in ?? () from /usr/lib/i386-linux-gnu/libqtnetwork.so.4
#11 0xb719777a in qmetacallevent::placemetacall(qobject*) () from /usr/lib/i386-linux-gnu/libqtcore.so.4
#12 0xb719f58b in qobject::event(qevent*) () from /usr/lib/i386-linux-gnu/libqtcore.so.4
#13 0xb7635744 in qapplicationprivate::notify_helper(qobject*, qevent*) () from /usr/lib/i386-linux-gnu/libqtgui.so.4
#14 0xb763c223 in qapplication::notify(qobject*, qevent*) () from /usr/lib/i386-linux-gnu/libqtgui.so.4
#15 0xb7185eda in qcoreapplication::notifyinternal(qobject*, qevent*) () from /usr/lib/i386-linux-gnu/libqtcore.so.4
#16 0xb71896ad in qcoreapplicationprivate::sendpostedevents(qobject*, int, qthreaddata*) () from /usr/lib/i386-linux-gnu/libqtcore.so.4
#17 0xb7189bbc in qcoreapplication::sendpostedevents(qobject*, int) () from /usr/lib/i386-linux-gnu/libqtcore.so.4
#18 0xb71b5f6e in ?? () from /usr/lib/i386-linux-gnu/libqtcore.so.4
#19 0xb6b5983e in g_main_context_dispatch () from /lib/i386-linux-gnu/libglib-2.0.so.0
#20 0xb6b59be8 in ?? () from /lib/i386-linux-gnu/libglib-2.0.so.0
#21 0xb6b59ca8 in g_main_context_iteration () from /lib/i386-linux-gnu/libglib-2.0.so.0
#22 0xb71b58bf in qeventdispatcherglib::processevents(qflags<qeventloop::processeventsflag>) () from /usr/lib/i386-linux-gnu/libqtcore.so.4
#23 0xb76ea32e in ?? () from /usr/lib/i386-linux-gnu/libqtgui.so.4
#24 0xb71849f3 in qeventloop::processevents(qflags<qeventloop::processeventsflag>) () from /usr/lib/i386-linux-gnu/libqtcore.so.4
#25 0xb7184d19 in qeventloop::exec(qflags<qeventloop::processeventsflag>) () from /usr/lib/i386-linux-gnu/libqtcore.so.4
#26 0xb718a89e in qcoreapplication::exec() () from /usr/lib/i386-linux-gnu/libqtcore.so.4
#27 0xb7633974 in qapplication::exec() () from /usr/lib/i386-linux-gnu/libqtgui.so.4
#28 0x08080972 in main ()
(gdb) disassemble 0xb6fc293e
dump of assembler code for function _znk6qtimer8intervalev:
   0xb6fc2938 <+0>:	push   %ebp
   0xb6fc2939 <+1>:	mov    %esp,%ebp
   0xb6fc293b <+3>:	mov    0x8(%ebp),%eax
=> 0xb6fc293e <+6>:	mov    0xc(%eax),%eax
   0xb6fc2941 <+9>:	pop    %ebp
   0xb6fc2942 <+10>:	ret    
end of assembler dump.
```
hans-martin
